title: Scooped by Scoles, Typophile posts their review of Indie Fonts
content:
We can only hope that once you've seen our review of Indie Fonts, it will be clear that the photo essay was in the works before Stephen beat us to the punch over at Typographica -- not that we could ever hope to compete with his prose ( [and](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015090404/http:/www.moderndrunkardmagazine.com/issues/10_02/10_02_bar_signs.htm) [prolific](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015090404/http:/www.bullworks.net/virtual/newstuff/buster.htm) [linking](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015090404/http:/yoga.tripod.co.jp/flash/kikkomaso.swf)) anyway...   
   
40,000 Words: A Look at Indie Fonts   
 [http://www.typophile.com/reviews/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015090404/http:/www.typophile.com/reviews/)   
   
Indie Fonts Brings Unseen Type to the Masses   
 [http://typographi.ca/2002\_12\_17.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015090404/http:/typographi.ca/2002_12_17.php)   
   
Indie Fonts home at P22   
 [http://www.p22.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015090404/http:/www.p22.com/)
author: Jared Benson

comments.content:
You call that a review? Hehe. I've added the   
link to the Typographica entry.   
   
It sure is a pretty bunch of pictures. Now that's   
what Kegler should be using to promote the   
thing. License the gallery to him and he'll   
make a bundle on new book sales.   
   
BTW, note the new handle. (I shall shed this   
"Scoles" nickname, one post at time)
